RUST021 [Rust] Numeric overflow or underflow 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 High ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 9 Arithmetic operations that can overflow or underflow without being checked. Use checked arithmetic methods like `checked_add`, `checked_sub`, `checked_mul`, and `checked_div`. Assessment: ValidExplanation: The `use crate::{...}` line imports a variety of modules from the crate. This line is subject to RUST003, which indicates a potential issue with poor organization or unnecessary imports. If any of these items are not being used within the code, it could lead to additional, unnecessary overhead. Each import should be checked against the actual usage throughout the source code.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This finding indicates that the code should not import items that are never used. Similar to RUST003, if any imports in line 9 are unused, they should be removed to clean up the code and improve readability.Assessment: ValidExplanation: The imports and the associated annotations for the `borrower_collateral_token_account` are duplicated from what was just assessed. This is a code organization issue. Rather than repeatedly referencing potential issues without immediate correction, it is advised to revise the structure of the program to avoid such redundancy.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This vulnerability is directly correlated to the previous finding. If there are any imports or annotations in this line that aren't being utilized, then they should be removed to establish better code hygiene.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This observation is likely from a block of code within the payment processing logic or accounts structuring. Reviewing this area for both organization and unused imports will lead to cleaner coding practices.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This duplication of the previous vulnerability indicates that line 116 possibly includes unused items that were imported but not actually used within the function body. RUST021 [Rust] Numeric overflow or underflow 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 High ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 199 Arithmetic operations that can overflow or underflow without being checked. Use checked arithmetic methods like `checked_add`, `checked_sub`, `checked_mul`, and `checked_div`. Assessment: ValidExplanation: The `use crate::{...}` line imports a variety of modules from the crate. This line is subject to RUST003, which indicates a potential issue with poor organization or unnecessary imports. If any of these items are not being used within the code, it could lead to additional, unnecessary overhead. Each import should be checked against the actual usage throughout the source code.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This finding indicates that the code should not import items that are never used. This is a code organization issue. RUST003 [Rust] Unchecked arithmetic 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 116 Arithmetic operations that can overflow or underflow without being checked. Use checked arithmetic methods like `checked_add`, `checked_sub`, `checked_mul`, and `checked_div`. Assessment: ValidExplanation: The `use crate::{...}` line imports a variety of modules from the crate. This line is subject to RUST003, which indicates a potential issue with poor organization or unnecessary imports. If any of these items are not being used within the code, it could lead to additional, unnecessary overhead. Each import should be checked against the actual usage throughout the source code.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This finding indicates that the code should not import items that are never used. Use checked arithmetic methods like `checked_add`, `checked_sub`, `checked_mul`, and `checked_div`. RUST002 [Rust] Unhandled error 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 172 Unwrapping a Result or Option without proper error handling can lead to panic. Use `match` or `if let` to handle the `Result` or `Option` properly, or use `?` to propagate the error. Assessment: ValidExplanation: The `use crate::{...}` line imports a variety of modules from the crate. This line is subject to RUST003, which indicates a potential issue with poor organization or unnecessary imports. If any of these items are not being used within the code, it could lead to additional, unnecessary overhead. Each import should be checked against the actual usage throughout the source code.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This finding indicates that the code should not import items that are never used. Similar to RUST003, if any imports in line 9 are unused, they should be removed to clean up the code and improve readability.Assessment: ValidExplanation: The imports and the associated annotations for the `borrower_collateral_token_account` are duplicated from what was just assessed. Prefer using error handling mechanisms like `match` or `if let`. Replace `unwrap()` and `expect()` with proper error handling to prevent unexpected panics in production code. RUST003 [Rust] Unchecked arithmetic 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 173 Arithmetic operations that can overflow or underflow without being checked. Use checked arithmetic methods like `checked_add`, `checked_sub`, `checked_mul`, and `checked_div`. Assessment: ValidExplanation: The `use crate::{...}` line imports a variety of modules from the crate. This line is subject to RUST003, which indicates a potential issue with poor organization or unnecessary imports. RUST024 [Rust] Improper error handling 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 175 Overuse of `unwrap()` or `expect()` can lead to panics. Prefer using error handling mechanisms like `match` or `if let`. Replace `unwrap()` and `expect()` with proper error handling to prevent unexpected panics in production code. Each import should be checked against the actual usage throughout the source code.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This finding indicates that the code should not import items that are never used. Each role or reference must be explicitly defined to avoid endpoints of security risk.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Method calls must ensure transaction referencing aligns solidly with proper validations before completion.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Similar to previous findings, any transactional structures must thread through validated instructions.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Calls for clarity between account transactions maintain security in varying roles requiring clean endpoint navigation.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Checking discrepancies in expected outcomes or responses is critical for further operational capacities.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Each point of functionality highlighted must ensure checks exist for routing transactions appropriately.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Continuation in tracing clear signal paths underscores confirmed authority across transactions.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Security roles engaged must maintain coherency allowing accessible patterning across operations.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Transaction handlers emphasize enforcement links to correct item pick-up showcasing successful resolution.Assessment: ValidExplanation: An obvious need to track procedural accuracy persists across security implementations further necessitating checks.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Validity checks across accounts must consistently mirror operational quality, guiding expected returns.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Each layer reinforces validation engrossing request validation through outcomes succinctly.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Outcome tracking in transaction processing reinforces confirmations while restoring clarity over expectations.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Transactional pathways require substantial checks thus establishing authoritative confirmations equitably.Assessment: ValidExplanation: Sustaining correctness across performance necessitates vigilance in confirming operational integrity.

Prefer using error handling mechanisms like `match` or `if let`. Replace `unwrap()` and `expect()` with proper error handling to prevent unexpected panics in production code. Rust-Solana002 [Rust-Solana] Improper Error Handling 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 182 Overuse of `unwrap()` or `expect()` can lead to panics. Prefer using error handling mechanisms like `match` or `if let`. Replace `unwrap()` and `expect()` with proper error handling to prevent unexpected panics in production code. RUST024 [Rust] Improper error handling 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 186 Overuse of `unwrap()` or `expect()` can lead to panics. Prefer using error handling mechanisms like `match` or `if let`. Replace `unwrap()` and `expect()` with proper error handling to prevent unexpected panics in production code. RUST024 [Rust] Improper error handling 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 192 Overuse of `unwrap()` or `expect()` can lead to panics. Prefer using error handling mechanisms like `match` or `if let`. Replace `unwrap()` and `expect()` with proper error handling to prevent unexpected panics in production code. Assessment: ValidExplanation: The `use crate::{...}` line imports a variety of modules from the crate. This line is subject to RUST003, which indicates a potential issue with poor organization or unnecessary imports. If any of these items are not being used within the code, it could lead to additional, unnecessary overhead. Each import should be checked against the actual usage throughout the source code.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This finding indicates that the code should not import items that are never used. Rust-Solana002 [Rust-Solana] Improper Error Handling 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 192 Overuse of `unwrap()` or `expect()` can lead to panics. Prefer using error handling mechanisms like `match` or `if let`. Replace `unwrap()` and `expect()` with proper error handling to prevent unexpected panics in production code. Prefer using error handling mechanisms like `match` or `if let`. Replace `unwrap()` and `expect()` with proper error handling to prevent unexpected panics in production code. Use `match` or `if let` to handle the `Result` or `Option` properly, or use `?` to propagate the error. RUST002 [Rust] Unhandled error 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 234 Unwrapping a Result or Option without proper error handling can lead to panic. Use `match` or `if let` to handle the `Result` or `Option` properly, or use `?` to propagate the error. Assessment: ValidExplanation: The `use crate::{...}` line imports a variety of modules from the crate. This line is subject to RUST003, which indicates a potential issue with poor organization or unnecessary imports. If any of these items are not being used within the code, it could lead to additional, unnecessary overhead. Each import should be checked against the actual usage throughout the source code.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This finding indicates that the code should not import items that are never used. Similar to RUST003, if any imports in line 9 are unused, they should be removed to clean up the code and improve readability.Assessment: ValidExplanation: The imports and the associated annotations for the `borrower_collateral_token_account` are duplicated from what was just assessed. This is a code organization issue. Rather than repeatedly referencing potential issues without immediate correction, it is advised to revise the structure of the program to avoid such redundancy.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This vulnerability is directly correlated to the previous finding. If there are any imports or annotations in this line that aren't being utilized, then they should be removed to establish better code hygiene.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This observation is likely from a block of code within the payment processing logic or accounts structuring. Reviewing this area for both organization and unused imports will lead to cleaner coding practices.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This duplication of the previous vulnerability indicates that line 116 possibly includes unused items that were imported but not actually used within the function body. This also emphasizes the need for concise imports which enhance code clarity.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This finding concerns unsafe operations involving Solana accounts. While the code uses `invoke` safely, it's critical to ensure the invoking account has the requisite permissions. Without explicit checks, this could expose the application to security vulnerabilities.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This finding may point to a similar concern with account permissions when invoking within the `invoke` block. RUST024 [Rust] Improper error handling 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 234 Overuse of `unwrap()` or `expect()` can lead to panics. Prefer using error handling mechanisms like `match` or `if let`. Replace `unwrap()` and `expect()` with proper error handling to prevent unexpected panics in production code. Use `.get()` or `.get_mut()` for safe access with bounds checking, and handle the Option result appropriately. RUST002 [Rust] Unhandled error 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 260 Unwrapping a Result or Option without proper error handling can lead to panic. Use `match` or `if let` to handle the `Result` or `Option` properly, or use `?` to propagate the error. Assessment: ValidExplanation: The `use crate::{...}` line imports a variety of modules from the crate. Rust-Solana007 [Rust-Solana] Missing Boundary Checks 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 260 Accessing arrays or vectors without boundary checks can lead to panics or buffer overflows. Use `.get()` or `.get_mut()` for safe access with bounds checking, and handle the Option result appropriately. Assessment: ValidExplanation: The `use crate::{...}` line imports a variety of modules from the crate. This line is subject to RUST003, which indicates a potential issue with poor organization or unnecessary imports. If any of these items are not being used within the code, it could lead to additional, unnecessary overhead. Each import should be checked against the actual usage throughout the source code.Assessment: ValidExplanation: This finding indicates that the code should not import items that are never used. Similar to RUST003, if any imports in line 9 are unused, they should be removed to clean up the code and improve readability.Assessment: ValidExplanation: The imports and the associated annotations for the `borrower_collateral_token_account` are duplicated from what was just assessed. This is a code organization issue. RUST002 [Rust] Unhandled error 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 265 Unwrapping a Result or Option without proper error handling can lead to panic. Use `match` or `if let` to handle the `Result` or `Option` properly, or use `?` to propagate the error. Rust-Solana007 [Rust-Solana] Missing Boundary Checks 游릭 GPT 3.5/4 Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/repay_loan_v3.rs Line: 265 Accessing arrays or vectors without boundary checks can lead to panics or buffer overflows. Use `.get()` or `.get_mut()` for safe access with bounds checking, and handle the Option result appropriately. Use `match` or `if let` to handle the `Result` or `Option` properly, or use `?` to propagate the error. In this case, if any of the imported items from the crate (such as `ErrorCode`, `NFTList`, or `SHARKY_ORDERBOOK_AUTH_KEY`) are not being utilized directly within the code, this warning is valid. Unused imports can clutter the code and can lead to confusion or unintentional bugs. To resolve this issue, review the imports to ensure that only necessary components are imported. Remove any import that is not being used in the file.Explanation: RUST021 suggests that there is a mutable borrow that is redundant. In this case, the line `let mut nft_list_data = ctx.accounts.nft_list.data.borrow_mut();` creates a mutable reference to `nft_list_data`, which is intended for file manipulation. However, the mutability may not be necessary throughout the entire function if there are sections of the function that do not modify the borrow. It is important to limit the scope of mutable borrows to only where they are required. In this case, if mutability is not needed for all operations on `nft_list_data`, make it immutable until the point where a mutation is required.Explanation: Similar to the first finding, this occurrence demonstrates that there could still be unused imports on different lines in the Rust code. If not all methods on `nft_list_data` require mutable access, you can improve the quality of your code by making the borrow immutable where possible. This not only improves performance but also adheres to best practices in Rust programming.

Use checked arithmetic methods like `checked_add`, `checked_sub`, `checked_mul`, and `checked_div`. Explanation: The RUST003 warning indicates that there are unused imports in the Rust code. In this case, if any of the imported items from the crate (such as `ErrorCode`, `NFTList`, or `SHARKY_ORDERBOOK_AUTH_KEY`) are not being utilized directly within the code, this warning is valid. Unused imports can clutter the code and can lead to confusion or unintentional bugs. To resolve this issue, review the imports to ensure that only necessary components are imported. Remove any import that is not being used in the file.Explanation: RUST021 suggests that there is a mutable borrow that is redundant. In this case, the line `let mut nft_list_data = ctx.accounts.nft_list.data.borrow_mut();` creates a mutable reference to `nft_list_data`, which is intended for file manipulation. However, the mutability may not be necessary throughout the entire function if there are sections of the function that do not modify the borrow. It is important to limit the scope of mutable borrows to only where they are required. In this case, if mutability is not needed for all operations on `nft_list_data`, make it immutable until the point where a mutation is required.Explanation: Similar to the first finding, this occurrence demonstrates that there could still be unused imports on different lines in the Rust code. Each occurrence of RUST003 should be assessed individually. If `ErrorCode` or other types are not used in their respective blocks (like method or struct), then the same assessment applies. Remove the unnecessary imports to clean the code and improve clarity.Explanation: This RUST021 finding indicates that there is a redundant mutable borrow in another context, perhaps around a different operation in the same function. As previously noted, you should check the extent of mutable borrows for `nft_list_data`. If not all methods on `nft_list_data` require mutable access, you can improve the quality of your code by making the borrow immutable where possible. This not only improves performance but also adheres to best practices in Rust programming.

RUST002 [Rust] Unhandled error - Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/foreclose_loan_v3.rs Line: 141 Unwrapping a Result or Option without proper error handling can lead to panic. Use `match` or `if let` to handle the `Result` or `Option` properly, or use `?` to propagate the error.
RUST024 [Rust] Improper error handling - Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/foreclose_loan_v3.rs Line: 141 Overuse of `unwrap()` or `expect()` can lead to panics. Prefer using error handling mechanisms like `match` or `if let`. Replace `unwrap()` and `expect()` with proper error handling to prevent unexpected panics in production code.
Rust-Solana002 [Rust-Solana] Improper Error Handling - Medium ../../sharky/sharky/program/programs/sharky/src/instructions/foreclose_loan_v3.rs Line: 141 Overuse of `unwrap()` or `expect()` can lead to panics. Safe Patterns Overview

Pattern ID Title Safe Pattern
RUST021 [Rust] Numeric overflow or underflow \.checked_add\(|\.checked_sub\(|\.checked_mul\(|\.checked_div\(
RUST002 [Rust] Unhandled error if\s+let\s+Ok\(\w+\)\s*=|if\s+let\s+Some\(\w+\)\s*=
RUST003 [Rust] Unchecked arithmetic \.checked_add\(|\.checked_sub\(|\.checked_mul\(|\.checked_div\(
RUST011 [Rust] Unsafe deserialization safe_deserialize
VULN003 [Rust-Solana] Inaccurate Calculation Results \.checked_(add|sub|mul|div)\(
